paper_abstract: We give a short proof of the following result on the distribution of three-term arithmetic progressions in sparse subsets of F-p(n). For every alpha > 0 there exists a constant C - C(alpha) such that the following holds for all r >= Cp-n/2 and for almost all sets R of size r of F-p(n). Let A be any subset of R of size at least alpha r; then A contains a non-trivial three-term arithmetic progression. This is an analogue of a hard theorem by Kohayakawa, Luczak and Rodl. The proof uses a version of Green's regularity lemma for subsets of a typical random set, which is of interest in its own right.
paper_title: On the Distribution of Three-Term Arithmetic Progressions in Sparse Subsets of F-p(n)
